fif_core

Class ParallelFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • fif_core.Filter
      • fif_core.ParallelFilter

  • public class ParallelFilter
extends Filter
    This class represent a parallel filter, that is a composite structure for two or more filters in which the order is not important.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Troiano Lorenzo

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ParallelFilter(Aggregator a, Filter... list)
      Builder that sets the aggregator and the list of filters composing the parallel filter.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ParallelFilter

        public ParallelFilter(Aggregator a,
                      Filter... list)
        Builder that sets the aggregator and the list of filters composing the parallel filter.

        You can set a variable numbers of filters.

        Preconditions:

        1-The aggregator is not equal to null.

        2-None of the filters must be null.

        Postconditions:

        1-The aggregator and filters are set correctly.

        Parameters:
        a - The aggregator you want to set in this filter.
        list - The list of filters you want to set in this filter.

    • Method Detail

      • doFilter

        public double doFilter(Resource r,
                       double value)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        Overridden method of Filter class: provides the filtering for the parallel filter structure.

        The output value is calculated filtering with each filter and then aggregate with the aggregator the filtered values.

        Preconditions:

        1-The resource is not equal to null.
        2-The value is not equal to null.

        Postconditions:

        1-The filtering and aggregation are done correctly returning a value between 0 and 1.

        Specified by:
        doFilter in class Filter
        Parameters:
        r - The resource you want to filter.
        value - The maximum threshold value of the filtering.
        Returns:
        the aggregated filtered value.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getAggregator

        public Aggregator getAggregator()

      • getAllFilters

        public java.util.AbstractList<Filter> getAllFilters()
        This method returns an abstract list of all the filters in the parallel filter.

        You can modify internal state of the parallel filters using the abstract list methods.

        Postconditions:

        1-It's returned the list of filters.

        Returns:
        the list of filters

      • setAggregator

        public void setAggregator(Aggregator a)
        This method allows to set the aggregator of this filter.

        Preconditions:

        1-The aggregator is not equal to null.

        Postconditions:

        1-The aggregator is set correctly.

        Parameters:
        a - The aggregator you want to set in this filter.

      • setParallelFilters

        public void setParallelFilters(Filter... list)
        This method allows to set a list of filters composing the parallel filter.

        Every time you call this method, the previous internal filters are destroyed and replaced by the new filters.
        You can set a variable numbers of filters.

        Preconditions:

        1-None of the filters must be null.

        Postconditions:

        1-The filters are set correctly.

        Parameters:
        list - The list of filters you want to set in this filter.
